item.title: DSLs Are Terrible
item.description: DSL’s (Domain Specific Languages) are often terrible. Each DSL is a special snowflake, delicately floating from the heavens straight into in your eye. Only then you realize the snowflake is actually a metal throwing star. The problem with a DSL is that it always starts so simple: “can we just do this one edge case real quick?” Over time, it grows into a whole inner platform often re-creating the outer platform it was intended to simplify.
